DOC.brief_summary: This is a single site, prospective, non-blinded, non-randomized, non-interventional study designed to evaluate the effect of changes in patient position on the measurement of respiratory heat loss (enthalpy). This study would be carried out on patients whose operation requires the use of the steep Trendelenburg position independent of this study.
DOC.brief_title: Effect of the Steep Trendelenburg Position on Respiratory Gas Heat Content
DOC.criteria: age greater than 18 years scheduled for an elective surgical procedure requiring general anesthesia, positive pressure ventilation using an endotracheal tube and the steep Trendelenburg position Adults unable to give primary consent age less than 18 years pregnancy prisoners infusion of inotropic drugs positive end expiratory pressure (PEEP) requirements >8 cm H2O Women, minorities or nonEnglish speaking subjects will not be excluded.
